chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin O Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at $263.00 payable to Midtown Shell

Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, restitution and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fees, restitution and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Correction in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No possession of any real or fake weapons.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- NO CONTACT with victim P.K., and Midtown Shell located at 641 N. Hawley Road.

- Psychiatric Evaluation.
- Cognitive Intervention.
- Cooperate with the Department and follow through with any recommended programs/treatment/services deemed appropriate.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

charges.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin O Butler

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing ( 37 pages) commencing 09-28-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS with 107 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3.5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No possession of any real or fake weapons.
- Maintain employment. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Complete a psychiatric evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Complete a cognitive intervention program.
- Cooperate with the department and follow through with any recommended programs/treatment/services deemed appropriate. 
- No contact with victim P.K. and Midtown Shell located at 641 N. Hawley Road.
- Restitution set at $263.00 payable to Midtown Shell.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, restitution, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. 
 Court ordered that all court costs, fees, restitution, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Kevin O Butler in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Kevin O Butler.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.
Received and Filed: Defendant's Character Letters
Upon request from the parties, Court rescheduled plea and sentencing to September 28 at 9 AM.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Kevin O Butler in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense states it does ot wish to proceed with the bail bond hearing.  Scheduling conference held.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kevin O Butler in court, appear by video with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz, appear by video.  Defendant Kevin O Butler in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Pavel L. K.; Midtown Shell at 641 N. Hawley Road
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kevin O Butler in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Kevin O Butler in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin O Butler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
